text: Klares Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, etwas Karamell, s칲륿ich, leicht fruchtig, Orangen, Honig, sehr s칲ffig.
33 cl. bottle. A hazy amber colour with white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, hops, spice, fruit, straw and with a bitter finish.

[email맗rotected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - Orange pour with white head. Sweet fruity and malty, light citrus accents, caramel, light grassy and floral hoppy bitter close.
12 fl oz bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a small off white head. Aroma is mild herbal and toasted malty. Medium dry, toasted and slight herbal. Dry herbal and flat malty finish.

Clear bronze big head. Aroma of caramel, toast, floral hops. Classic Anchor steam taste of malts, toast and just a little dry bitterness. Finish is more of the same. Well, I like it, really do, but can뇺 taste a big difference from the original. If anything the aroma might give away the hops, but it뇹 not drastic. Cool anyways, if only a little twist on the og.
From Boxbeers. In Teku glass. Playing Tales Across Time. Great toffee nose. Mouth nice too but with a strange citrusy sourness that isnt unpleasant but off. Very different from regular anchor steam
Bottled. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, hops, fruits, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of fruits, hops, malt, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.

Hazy orange color with off-white head. Aroma is quite malty with orange jam notes. Taste has also nice orange notes, a bit spicy, solid malt backbone, light earthy hop bitterness on the finish. Medium body, medium to low carbonation, quite smooth feel. Overall it뇹 a really well made and tasty ale.

Slightly cloudy amber/orange with a foamy white head. Very bready aroma without much else. Tastes like an amber ale with a slight cooked vegetable hop bitterness. Kind of thin bodied. Leaves a lasting dry vegetal bitterness. I뇴 not sure but this might not be fresh as it didn뇺 have the clean taste of Anchor Steam or a clear hop bitterness you뇫 expect from dry hopping. I뇳l re-rate when I get another one.
Tap at pub. Pours amber with medium sized fluffy head. Aroma has mild pine and citrus with caramel malts. Taste has some citrus with caramel malts. Pretty good.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Slightly cloudy tan brew with small off white head, good lacing. Aroma of caramel malts, green fruit; a little citrus and resin. Taste is moderate malt up front, bready with caramel, slowly emerging green fruit with a slightly resinous finish. Nice balance between the malt and the hops and a good hops profile but not trying to be an IPA. I

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, bread and hops.

Appearance:

Hazy amber/orange beer with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread and hops.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Honestly; the dry-hopping is not even that noticeable, but it is only slightly better than its original even though it gets the same rating from me.

Aroma: herbs and floral notes, weak grapefruit notes.
Appearance: hazy golden color and white head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, grapefruit peel, floral, slightly stalky, dry.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation.
Overall: nice California Common, decent bitterness, nice hoppy notes.

Bottle from Eltham Wines. Dark amber pour with a white head. Apricot, sultana, tangerine and toffee aroma. Flavours of caramel, tangerine, apricot, sultana, orange zest, pepper. Sweet-malt-fruit fusion on the palate. Nice.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Oily palate.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are grain, bread, malt, hops, caramel and has a light bitter grainy finish.

Bottle, 5.4%. Slightly hazy amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, little toasted, hops and a little grapefruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, little toasted, hops, medium sweet, little grainy, hop, little grapefruit and a little bitter.

Bottle from Boxbeers. Light hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - fruity and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 230417

As a hop lover I was expecting a good hop nose. It disappointed as there was almost no hop nose. It did have a nice malt aroma but that뇹 it. 

Overall quite drinkable but not what I was expecting. 

Also I wish that Anchor would indicate the brewed-on date.

Fruity fragrance Fruity and lightly dried fruit in taste. Good bust that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. A little alcohol taste at the end of the beer. Follow me @ Kung av 칬l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Clear amber, white froth. Thick, caramely aroma, somewhat bready. Bready flavour, caramely with good bitter finish.
Bread biscuits and malt. Sweeter malt and watery taste. Finish is clear and slightly bitter.

Draft at the Kaisla, Helsinki, Finland. Enjoyed on Apr 5th, 2017.
Clear amber color with a small to medium size off-white head. 
Sweet hops, herbal notes and sugar in the aroma. 
The flavor is sweet malt, sugar and herbal hops. Mild bitterness. 
Not really a beer that I뇳l remember.

Bottled. Pours clear amber colour with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel and piney notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and decent bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice and pleasent brew. 游游游游
Nose is small but sweet. Golden light hazy. Taste is malty sweet with tones of honey and dried fruir. Palate leaves with sweetness and light bitterness.

Pours a slightly hazy coppery orangish color with off-white head. Citrus, light fruits, and some cereal grain on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with a nice balance between the malt and hops.
Keg at the ushers.. Murky amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet caramel toffee malts nose... Massive woody caramel crystal toffee fruit.. Light floral finish
Bottle from Supersaves Wine, Westbourne. Malty one the nose with some grassy hop aromas. Flavour is biscuit malts with a nice citrus hop finish. Enjoyed but preferred the non dry hopped version.

Cloudy with big head. The beer has a peppery and zesty aroma with nice, juicy malts. The mouthfeel is creamy and very satisfying. Taste is very well balanced with juicy malts and mild bitterness. Quite nice finish with zesty notes. Its wat better then the original version. Very drinkable, a good bbq beer.
UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a light amber colour beer with a medium head. Fruity and hoppy with notes of Steam and smoke. Dry finish.

Da hat doch einer mit belgischer Hefe nachvergoren 游. Toll kr칛utriger Smell, a little bit funky und sch칬n green. Der Trunk toll austariert, zuerst angesweetet malty dann getreidig angestumpf und zum Ende mit fettem White Wine Dry Out(inklusive Lemon Flashes 游땙). Hui!!! Mal ein ganz au른r-und ungew칬hnliches Cali. 355ml Fl칛schchen from BEYOND BEER in HH. 3,50.

Pours two fingers of head on a hazy straw body.
Aroma is grains with an undercurrent of lemon and pineapple.
Taste mild grains, mild lemon and pine bitterness. 
Texture is crisp.
The dry-hop is a nice addition

355 ml bottle from BeerLovers.
Dark amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of ripe fruits, bread, caramel, tea leaves, red apples, some citrus.
Tastes quite similar, with more of the nice bready notes.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes smooth, medium bitter, medium dry, hoppy, zesty, piney, bready.

Really nice. Quaffable and smooth, with lovely bready malts, supported by various fruits and some tea like notes. Not very different to the regular Steam Beer, except some more depth and the finish, where the hops take over finally. Overall refreshing, balanced stuff, as always from Anchor.

Steam beers are not massively to my taste so I뇴 conscientiously trying to be objective. Honestly didn뇺 get much difference at all from the regular Anchor Steam. Was looking out for the extra hops - nothing. Same lovely orange colour and appealing smell as Anchor Steam, but not much more. Maybe the journey across the Atlantic did for it. Brotherhood Steam is a more interesting and accomplished variation on the style I think.

A copper color with a white head. The aroma contains some citrus and caramel. The flavor is slightly bitter with some citrus, toffee, and caramel. This is a bit drier than regular Steam is. This is old school Steam with a hoppy and dry kick. A new twist on a classic. Ernie I wish you could have tried this one.

Hardly an improvement on the original. Strangely malt-forward for a dry-hopped brew, more a playground for bread-and-caramel malts than any "new and classic hop varieties". Pour is meh, a lovely dark orange but with little head and light lacing. Orange caramel on the nose--no hops. Taste follows suit; malt, malt, and more malt, only with a yeasty tartness on the back end and a Noble hop pungency that doesn뇺 mesh all that well with all the malty joy. Finishes dry and bready. Not Anchor뇹 best.

On tap @ De Roestelberg, Kaatsheuvel.
Clear amber with an off-white head. Bready biscuity aroma with some caramel and hops. Taste is medium sweet. Although the hops are not overly present, for a dry-hopped beer, the end result is very quaffable and enjoyable.
Tap @ Kitty뇹 Helsinki, 25/02/17. Pours a reddish auburn brown with a small, off-white head. Aroma is red fruit, some citrus. Taste is dry with caramel, grain, citrus, slightly husky. Decent.

Het bier geprobeerd met Lieke bij het nationaal bier museum Alkmaar. Het is een heerlijk amandelkleurig bier met een volle schuimkraag. Het heeft een lekker hopachtige geur en smaak met een vleugje caramel.
Bottle. Floral orange biscuit malt and grass aroma. Hazy golden yellow with moderate off-white head. Mildly sweet citrus biscuit malt and mildly bitter hay flavor. Good body. Nice.

Tap @ Angleterre. 
Poured amber color with a thick white head. 
Biscuity malty, woody, harsh fruity aroma. 
Malty, bready, dusty, hoppy flavor. Much to like here, but at the same time bit dull. I just don뇺 like this style that much.

12 oz. bottle, consumed on 2-4-17. Pours a hazy bronze with a large amount of cream to beige-colored head. Extensive, thick lacing. Looks good across the board. Beery aroma peppered with bitter and floral hops. Scents of tangerine, baked apple, and cheap chewing gum. Smells like classic Anchor Steam but with a greater hops presence, unsurprisingly, but those scent elements don뇺 mesh well. Dry, mineral flavor. Pretzel, apple, and flowers. Some dryness. Slightly past its prime milk, unfortunately. A touch of mint. Tastes better than it smells, but I can뇺 say it tastes particularly good. Gets worse upon multiple sips. Frothy and smooth in the palate. Light body. Reasonably refreshing. An interesting but not particularly good twist on a classic craft beer that, let뇹 face it, is more historically important than it actually is good.

Bottle 0.33l at home Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Taste with adamnowek, Alexei, Melanie and Jeca. 14.01.2017. Pour it clear amber color with medium white head. Aroma toffee, some raisins. Taste starts with caramel note, later citrus with some grassy feel until the end, after taste malty, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation. Interesting.

0.355 l bottle from 뇝peciaalbierpakket.nl, bottled in August 2016 (bottle code: 6G3). Slightly hazy, orangeish amber with a medium large, frothy, stable, off-white head. Sweetish, quite resiny and fruity aroma of honey, mango, orange jam and pine. Slightly bitter, sweetish, moderately fruity and quite resiny taste of mango, orange jam and lots of pine with a honeyish and caramelly background and a medium long, quite bitter, resiny and dry finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very decent beer that I would have liked to try fresher, but unfortunately the import to Europe took a while.

Draught at WilliamK Kurvi. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, toast, malts, grass and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, malts, toast, pine and grass. Very nice steam beer.
12 oz. bottle. Cloudy amber, large off white head that lasts. Aroma was sweet fruit, tropical fruits. Taste was moderate bitter, citrus, grapefruit, light pine.

Bottle from Freshfields Market, Croydon. It pours golden - amber with a thick white head. The aroma is fresh, bready, cereal, hay, some sweet orange, sherbet and a touch of floral notes. The taste is crisp, dry, firm bitterness, floral, white bread, toasty grain, cereal, light spice, orange peel, light grapefruit and pepper with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Well rounded and rather drinkable. Decent gear,

Tap (Kitty뇹, Helsinki)
Nice fruity hoppy aroma. Pleasantly spicy in the taste. Light palate, crisp. A bit boring, but not bad. 2.5-2.7-ish.
Rerate: Keg (Rotterdam, Helsinki)
Cleaner, fruitier, more characterful. Pretty tasty.

12fl oz bottle at home from Bert뇹 Bierhuis Biltstraat, Utrecht. Nose is malty. Body is clear orange golden, head is medium, beige, creamy, fully lasting, good lacing. Aroma is tropical fruits, peach, honey, grass. Medium sweet, light bitter, hint of fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting malty medium bittersweet, later rather hoppy bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Easy, quite refreshing, simple but tasty, well balanced, nice one.
Clear copper colour with small head going to the sides of the glass. Aroma has caramel malts, pines and grapefruit hops. Taste has pines and malty notes. Medium body and medium carbonation.

[email맗rotected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clear amber light coppery colour. Malty, earthy herbyvnose, light nutty malty notes. Med bodied, crisp clean. Flavour is surprisingly herbal, fresh herbs, bit fresh grassy. Clean finish. Cleansing, bit drying bitters. Dry caramel straw. Cant remember much of the normal version, but guess the strong greeness is the obvious difference.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is malt, citrus, orange, fruity hops, touch of stone fruits, some pine resin and mild perfume. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium. Smooth and balanced, very drinkable, quality stuff.

As per usual, the fermentation character on this Anchor beer is suspect at best. The ever present Anchor house character of not quite Styrofoam is there in spades. Goodie gumdrops! I dunno what else you뇫 need to know about this. It뇹 kinda orange, a little cloudy w/ a nice creamy head. I guess the nose has a passable APA-ish quality to it but, you know, nothing special. And then that weird Anchor taste. No sir, I don뇺 like it.
Bottle. Notes of caramel and citrus. A bit dry. Rather light mouthfeel. Tastes more like a regular american ale compared to the original steam beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours amber with a offwhite head.
Dominated by a caramell maltyness with a deacent amount of citrus and piney hops

M칬rkt guldf칛rgad 칬l. Apelsinskal, citrusfrukt, karamell, lite kryddig. Absolut god!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer Gonzo. Murky amber body with a medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma of peach, toasted marshmallow and dried orange peel. Flavour of pithy orange and floral hops. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. A great beer in excellent condition. Top quality.

(Anchor Dry-Hopped Steam Beer) Bottle 355ml served into a shaker, ABV 5.4%
Deep golden coloured body, clear, with a small but thick and creamy off-white head on top, good retention.
Aroma has orranges, light grapefruit, tropical fruits.
Taste has a sharp bitterness with citrus, orange peel, grapefruit, little bit of caramel and grassy hops.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Good one.
Not a whole lot different than Anchor Steam, to be honest. Aroma has some pine and citrus. Taste is much of the same.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 "6GR" imprinted on the back label of a 12floz bottle = bottling date of 08.18.2016. Third bottle had out of a recent 6-pack purchase (paid $8.99/six bottles, St. Louis MO area). Poured into a pint glass on 01.13.2017. Hazy copper in color with a fast forming and quickly receding beige head. Muted aroma.

Basically the dry-hopped version of Anchor Steam (tm) comes across as a beer that is half regular Anchor Steam and half generic APA beer. This beer is pretty good, quaffable, but one I will likely overlook in the future. Worth the try and would have again in a bar setting if there is a special.
330 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden amber with white head. Fruity, spicy with pine and citrus. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

From tap at In De Wildeman. Near clear amber with an off white head. Aroma of toffee, caramel, citrus, light fruity hops, resinous hop notes and malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

A subdued aroma of malt and a resin hops. Pours a hazy caramel color with a lasting off white foamy head. A medium body with a taste of caramel, malt and piney hops. Has a slightly bitter hop medicinal finish.

Nice find in my shitty grocer I뇳l take unrated top 50 of any style with my paper towels and the like. Dusty orange pour. Nose is some hoppy bitters and light toffee. Tastes of grapefruit pith, apples, caramel, and the original steam beer is there under the bitter hops. Interesting.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Big white fluffy head that lasts. Mild hoppy aromas and fine clean malts. Fresh hoppy and malty taste with a small but lingering bitterness. A very nice thirst quencher.

12 ounce bottle. Hazy amber, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of toasted malt, citrusy and tropical hops. The taste is caramel malt, grapefuit, citrus, mild tropical notes. Medium bodied, moderate lingering bitterness.

Pour is a clear copper with a large white head. Aroma is a nutty and caramel malt with an ever so slight hop. Flavor is more dry nutty malty-ness with a hop resin in the background. For being dry hopped this did not offer much in the way of hops. Of course Anchor doesn뇺 put a date on the bottle so this could be 5 months old and the hops could have faded.
Ljust b칛rnstensf칛rgad 칬l med ett ljusbeige skum. Doft och smak av citrus ljust br칬d och viss gr칛sighet.

Gylden brun klar med h칮yt eggegult skum. Luktet r칮de b칝r, honning, karamell og urter. Middels fylde. Middels bitterhet, lett s칮dme. Blomster, sitrus, lett brent karamell, gj칝r, krydder, urter. Middels lengde. Sitter kun igjen med bitterheten.

Bottle:
Slightly hazy, light amber with a thick beige head.
Strong fruit....tangerine, grain aroma.
Taste is light and airy, toffee malt, sweet citrus.
Fruity and malty.
An excellent adjustment to a classic beer.

Bottle. 5.4%. Best before 08.18. Pours a hazy, dull amber with a diminishing off-white/yellowish head. Slight lacing. Hoppy aroma. Fruit, malt in the background, increasing as it warms. Slightly fat. Flavour is hoppy and fruity on a sweetish malt background. Hint of caramel and a wee bit dusty as it warms. Bitter finish, with a hint of (sweet) liquorice. Light tart note. Also hops, caramel malt, a bit grainy, a spicy hint, and has a peculiar, fledgling off-note I can뇺 put my finger on. Lingering grassy hop note followed by an (overripe) fruit note. Overall good. 18.12.16.

12 ounce bottle from Uptown. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. A big sweet fruity nose. Fresh marmalade, toast, some toffee. Dusty earthy base, but a nice fruity hoppiness that makes this really drinkable. Way hoppier than I expected. Good.

12oz bottle. Anchor Brewing continues its decline. This just hit the market here, and it already tastes stale and old. Earthy, cheap, non-descript hop tone. Really unimpressive offering. Borderline off tastes, seems like it has some diacetyl, butterscotch. Weak stuff from the once solid Anchor.
355ml bottle, enjoyed straight out of the bottle. Caramel, herbs, fruit, butterscotsch. Smooth.

12oz bottle 12/13/16 (Trader Joe뇹 Naperville)-40춿 in Shaker-Pours a hazy light amber with a small white covering for a head. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of hops, malt, and grass. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and a bit of a surprise.

12oz bottle from the state store 
Pours hazy dark orange with a small off-white head, some lacing. Aroma is fruity, straw, dusty malts and orange peel. Flavor is fruity, grassy, grapefruit and citrus peel 
I didn뇺 care for this, it뇹 all over the place
Gyllengul med lite skum. Luktar svagt citrus, humligt. Smakar helt ok. Som en v칛lspelad lager, inget extremt. Helt ok t칬rstsl칛ckare.

355ml brown bottle poured into a pint glass. Aroma and flavour of grapefruit, orange peels, caramel and bread. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. Overall a solid brew.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. I am finding this to be a tasty beverage. The hop character is fruity and herbal. The malts are lightly sweet and caramel. There is a firm bitterness that lasts. Not bad.

10-DEC-2016, bottle @home, from Systembolaget G칬teborg.
Slightly hazy, dark golden with a low off-white head.
Aroma is grassy hoppy with some caramel malt. Taste the same. A touch of citrus and spice as well. Not an in-your-face-dry-hopping. Actually not an improvement of a nice brew. Medium body, lively carbonation, bitter with some sweetness.
Flaska. Klar guldf칛rgad med ett rikligt vitt skum. Dofter av frukt, malt och jord. Smakinslag av malt, h칬, blomster och frukt. Som en b칛ttre lager.

6-pack. Starting last night, almost gone. If you뇼e been looking for 25 years for alternatives to industrial beer, especially if you live on the west coast, Anchor Steam might hold a special place in your liver. It certainly does in mine. Until last night, I hadn뇺 heard that they had rolled out variants of it. I뇴 grateful for the chance to revisit an old favorite. Some old favorites are solid mainstream beers, as opposed to masterpieces, and this one is definitely of the solid variety, like it뇹 progenitor. Pours a slightly hazy medium amber with a dense and sudsy off white head that settles quickly to foam. Got that tangy Steam nose; kinda doughy, kinda vegetal, kinda weird, but in a quirky and likeable way rather than a QA problem way. It뇹 easy to see why this beer was always unconventional and "wrong," and they still went with it. There뇹 an herbal note to this variant. Slightly nutty mid palate, lots of tangy vegetal and doughy notes there too. Gets dry and shows a little white wine near the finish.

Pours clear amber with a large frothy off white head. Aromas of caramel, peach, resin, rye bread, citrus. Taste is fruity and floral with a nice caramel backbone. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Pours clear copper. Aroma is slightly hoppy, malty balance. Taste is malty, slight hops balance.

Hazy amber with a small beige head. The aroma has light caramel notes, spicy, piney, floral hops, and that classic yeast ester. The flavor is nicely balanced and very closely resembles the original. Nice balancing bitterness.

Crisp, super copper coloured body with a thinnish, single centimetre tall tan head. Aroma of nice and floral hops with some grassy and tropical fruit notes along with the more pungent and floral notes that are usually seen with Anchor. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong grassy and bittered malt flavour - just like the original with some grassy and more floral notes than before and a light sweetness from caramelised sugars and that pungent, spent grain flavour that is noticeable miles away. Aftertaste shows some dry bitter hops, a little malt flavour with nuts and earth by far the strongest and finishing well and relatively pungent. Overall, a nice newer take on a ridiculously old classic that shows fresh and well worth trying if you can find it! I sampled this twelve ounce stubby bottle purchased from Whole Foods in New York (Chelsea), New York on 03-December-2016 for US$2,99 sampled a few minutes later in my hotel room here in Chelsea on 03-December-2016.
Slight floral and fruity aroma and taste above and beyond the usual anchor steam. Still not a favorite, but it뇳l do.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty weak grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy finish.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Pours amber with a slight haze and a small, off-white head. Sweet, caramellish aroma - I don뇺 get any dryhopping what so ever. Medium body, fairly dry caramel accents with a bitter finish. A straight and well crafted beer, but by today뇹 standards merely a hoppy amber. 301116
Bottle. Amber beer with a ream head. Grapefruit aroma. Mineral and light grapefruit flavor with light pine. Medium bodied. Mineral and light grapefruit lingers with light pine.

Amber color. Nice , white head. Aroma of caramel malt and citrus. Malt dominates in taste with hoppy bitterness at the end. Medium body, moderate sweetness. Very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska fr친n SB. Smak och doft av humle, malt, jord, j칛st, citrus, tall, karamell, 칬vermogen frukt, br칬d med toner av gr칛s. Fruktig, torr, lagom s칬tma, fin beska.
Draft at Duckworth. Clear amber color, medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit and caramel. Taste is citrus, bread, cereal. Interesting.

N칛stintill klar, djup b칛rnstens f칛rgad, snyggt orange skum av sm bubblor.  Doft: Malt, gr칛s, skog, kola, humle, fruktkaka med mycket frukt, lite sur disktrasa. Smak: Malt, skog, gr칛s, sur disktrasa d.v.s. lager, humle, citrus, persikogodis, fruktkola. Svag 4:a i palate.

Bottle from Glug in Newcastle. Pours light brown, hazy, with a medium off white head which stays. Nose is classic Steam beer character: caramel, bread, little nutty, with the citrus notes boosted up and some lightly sherberty character alongside grapefruit peel. Taste feels a little light than usually with the citrus peel notes and sherbert making this sing. Caramel, bread, nutty.
@ Havregatan 20161125. Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and malty with grapefruity notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, medium bitter and fruity.

Bottle at home. It pours a lightly hazed orange color with a small white head. The aroma has rotten fruit and light hints of menthol. The flavor has more menthol, medicine and over ripe fruit basket. Medium medicinal bitterness. The dry hopping didn뇺 work with this one. Give me the regular Anchor Steam please.
Bottle - average size foamy head, light brown/copper color, good size citrus fruity hop aroma and flavor, well balanced with mildly sweet caramel malt, mildly bitter hop finish, very good overall
Trevlig och hyfsat smakrik upplevelse. Tydligt lite annan karakt칛r 칛n det vanliga "ankaret".

Spicy, grassy, earthy, hay and light grapefruit.
Amber colour, big off-white head that is creamy, good amount of lacing.
Medium bite, mid-sweet, lots of hay, and very malty.
Medium body, soft carbonation, hayish finish.

Appearance: Clear orange amber. Nice, creamy off-white head.
Aroma: Hops, citrus.
Taste: Hops, citrus, fruits. Light malt. Good balance.
Bought: Total Wine & More (Sterling), 355 ml, $1.99
Info: 8/11-2016
Bottle from SB. Cloudy amber with a medium off white head. Fruity and hoppy tones. Fruit, malt, hops and bitterness. Medium body with a dry finish.

Smell of corn flake, yeast and baking bread, mild cookie and some hoppy presence. Taste is dry and brisk, hoppy and surprisingly light too, very well balanced. Long bitter aftertaste with notes of lemon and pine. Nice

Flaska fr친n SB. Disig b칛rnstensf칛rgad med medelh칬gt kr칛migt smutsvitt skum. Karamellig doft, kolaremmar, lite tallskott och aprikoser. Fin kropp men rund mjuka kolasmaker utan att bli s칛rskilt s칬tt, men humlen k칛nns tr칬tt och kvar 칛r en gr칛sig beska som iofs funkar bra till kroppen. Ok
One of the best anchor steam beers out there. Hoppy goodness,뇿et not too heavy.

Bottle from Seijo Ishii. Pours orange-amber with a decent light beige head, lacing. Malty grain bread aroma, herbal hops and fragrant citrus, sweet caramel toffee lingering. Flavour of dry malt crackers, caramel, citrus. Spritzy carbonation and dry finish, mid-plate shows some body and malt sweetness. Really easy drinking, tingly herb finish. A couple of pints would go nicely.
Anchor spicing thing up: Aroma is bready malts with a fruity sensation. Taste is fruitier and more sweet than the original. Medium body and overal pleasant.

Draft pour at house of brews in Manhattan. Grassy on the nose. Pours a beautiful amber. Lightly hoppy. Light bodied. Goes down like a hoppy anchor steam. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Light amber colored with white head. Light malty aroma, some estery fruitiness of apples and pears and a faint sulphur aroma. The taste i medium malty sweet with a little sulphery flavor and a hoppy bitter and dry finish. Good balance snd lots of flavor.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours copper with an off-white head and lacing. The aroma is caramel, earthy hops, and tea. The taste is the same. It뇹 got a nice, earthy flavor to it.

Taps clear caramel with a nice, fine-bubbled pale buff head. Aroma offers woody hop and toasted malt notes. Flavor delivers hoppy, citrus and malty tones. Body is typical, but fizz is lively. Hop to it - but if you get too "steamed," please contact Lyft or Uber.
Golden color, medium white head. Sweet aromas of caramel, apricot, malt with slight hop character. Slight sweet taste of malt and caramel. Bitter finish that feels a bit off. Creamy mouthfeel.

Pours hazy amber with medium high white head
Aromas note very dry hopped. More bread, caramel, hop cones, pine, some herbal hoppyness
Taste has notes of malty breadyness, some tropical fruits, bread, hints of herbs, grass, pine, caramel
Flaska fr친n SB. Dimmigt orangef칛rgad med vitt skum. Maltig doft, inte s친 humlig. Lite skogig smak med k친da och barr.

Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is grassy, vegetal hops, caramel, fruity malts. Taste is pine, grassy / earthy malts, smooth caramel malts. A great hop touch on the Anchor vibe.

Bottle from Seijo. Pretty orange-amber color with a high, fine head. Nice citrus nose, bready malts, solid. Dry, earthy, peppery flavor, citrus, with a good peppery finish. I like this. Kicked it up a notch for sure.

Pours gold, clear, +1" of steady foam.

Caramel malt and light hops in the smell.

Hoppy, lightly bitter from the dry hopping. .hard to describe. A wee bit grassy a wee bit piney. The malt seems to have survived nicely as in the base beer.

Smooth mouthfeel with excellent drinkability.

My second bottle. The first, I had my doubts aboot but I do enjoy this one.

Looks like it was bottled July 4th.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Hazy bronze colour, rich head. Floral nose with ashand grapefruit. Dry with light-medium body and crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Ashy, fruity and salty with notes of apples and licorice. Mid bitter finish. Elegant, yet down to earth. True quality.

Bottle from Seijo Ishi store. Sweet, toasty, herbal, and malty nose. Copper/orange color. Malty, with some mild citrus, sweetened apricots, a light metallic touch in mid palate, all quite herbal and earthy. Medium body. Pleasant stuff. Very different from the regular Anchor Steam.
Bottle (355 ml) from Systembolaget. Clear deep golden, large white head. Bready malt, slightly fruity, herbal hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, lingering bitterness.
Bottle in NYC - Dry-hopping is only slightly noticable. A bit underwhelming. Medium malty, only few hops. Thats the thing with California Common. I dont really know what to do with that style.

12 oz bottle- Pours hazy dark orange with a large white head that retains well. Aroma is dry, yeasty, citrusy, lemon, fairly muted. The flavor is hoppy, caramel malts, earthy, the hops impart a large bitterness that lingers, citrusy and piney. Complex, unique, not quite my type of beer, but i can appreciate it.

355ml bottle from Systembolaget. Slightly hazy amber, frothy head, leaving good lacing. Hoppy citrus, herbal and pine aroma, toast, caramel and grains. Medium carbonated, medium-bodied, smooth mouthfeel. The taste follows the aroma, pine bitterness, earthy and herbal, caramel and toast. Resinous and leafy finish.

12 oz bottle.
Deep amber in color with a large, frothy, light tan head. Excellent retention and sudsy lacing. 

Fairly strong hoppy aroma. The flavor nearly matches the hoppiness found in the aroma but has notable malts as well. 

Feel: medium body; very smooth; medium carbonation. 

Overall: Anchor Steam transformed to something much more like an IPA.

Faint aroma of some fresh hops and some malt and corn. Nice deep orange color with a thick tan head. Sweet malt up front. Not much other depth. Earthy bitterness from hops next. Nice balance. Finish is slightly dry. Bitterness echo뇹 on the finish nicely. Solid brew

B칛rnstensf칛rgad med litet, vitt skum. Doftar h칬 och blommor, aprikos, ananas och aningen citrus. Maltig smak med fruktiga inslag av aprikos, ananas och pomerans, fin beska p친 slutet. Mediumkolsyrad. En trevlig variant p친 steam beer, t칛mligen komplex med bra balans mellan frukts칬tma och beska.
Flaska fr친n SB. B칛rnstensf칛rgad kul칬r med vit skumkrona. Doft av rostad malt och s칬t br칬ddeg. Mediums칬t med liten efterbeska. Smak av citrus- zest, mineralvatten, gr칛s och rostad malt.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Amber with a medium head. 
Sweetish aroma with grassy hops. 
Salty flavour with high bitterness. Some notes of cough-syrup. 
A bit odd.

355ml bottle. Clear amber with one finger tan head. Aroma is apricot, peach, citrus, orange, caramel, slightly toasted bread and toffee. Taste is plenty of citrus up front with orange, grapefruit zest and more flowery and herbal tones following and finally ending with the addition of a light malty layer of caramel and toast. Light mouthfeel, medium, prickly carbonation and lasting aftertaste with clean citrus and caramel intermingeling.

12oz bottle, thanks perigrinari. Large beige head atop crystal clear amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, some grapefruit, light bread. Taste is moderately sweet, orange, bread/cereal, light lager lemon, grapefruit. Light-medium body, some effervescence.

12 ounce bottle into lager glass, bottled on 8/18/2016. Pours slightly hazy deep orange/copper color with a 1 finger dense and fluffy off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of lemon, orange, pineapple, apricot, grapefruit, light pepper/pine, caramel, toasted biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/earthy hops, dark/bready malt, and light fruity yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of big lemon, orange, pineapple, apricot, grapefruit, light pepper/pine, caramel, toasted biscuit, light nuttiness, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange, pineapple, apricot, grapefruit, light pepper/pine, caramel, toasted biscuit, light nuttiness, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/earthy hops, dark/bready malt, and light fruity yeast flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth and moderately bready/grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is great; slight resin note near the end of the glass. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.4%. Overall this is an outstanding California common style! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/earthy hops, dark/bready malt, and light fruity yeast flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and easy to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.

Pours an amber color with a huge foamy head. Taste is hoppy and more like an IPA version of the steam beer. Pretty standard . Nothing stands out

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Trader Joe뇹. This is considerably better than the original. Gold color is nothing special, but there is much more flavor, and most of it hops. Where I find the original rather boring, the dry hopping gives some flavor. Dry malt flavor, and bitter finish. good session beer.
12oz bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Lighter citrus, toasted grains, floral, and earth.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Hazy dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt with notes of tangerine and wet grass. Taste is hard to pinpoint exactly but does feature tangerine, soft pine, mild grapefruit, and toffee notes. Not bad and, to me, an improvement over the regular Anchor Steam.

Bottle - Pours amber with a nice soapy/creamy off-white head. Aroma of buttered toast, light fruits. Flavors of buttery malts, fruity, citrus fruits, mild vanilla, mild banana, hoppy finish-aftertaste. Surprisingly good. The mild fruity notes and creamy center works well with the hops. Good balance.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head, nice lacing and lively carbonation. Aroma is of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and bready malt. Body is medium and tangy. Herbal hops, biscuit malt and ripe fruit fill the mouth. Finish is long, dry and very hoppy. Tasty brew.
Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Very light smell with some fruits. Similar taste. Smooth and easy to drink. However I didn뇺 feel the dry hops at all. A bit bland.

It뇹 not easy to make a new version of your magnum opus. For some people, their knowledge of craft beer begins and ends at Anchor Steam. For several others, it was the starting point. A different variation of this classic is the kind of thing that no one really asked for, yet here it is. Happily, what뇹 here is quite good. Copper-amber color with a slightly rocky long-lasting head. Aroma isn뇺 actually all that different considering the dry-hopping. Yeast and noble-type hop bouquet. Flavor breaks down like this: bread-like yeast, caramel malt, and earthy, spicy, and tea-like hops. Feel is crisp and refreshing. Basically, this drinks like Steam with just a bit more bitterness. Definitely different enough to notice, but not so extreme as to alienate anyone.
Bottle from Trader Joe뇹. Bready up front with a little toasty flavor. A little hoppiness. Flavor is a touch off. Not bad. Cant really compare to the original, as I don뇺 drink it often.
Pours a caramel color from a bottle. Smells lightly malty with some noble hop notes, flavor similar, thin. Okay beer.

Tap. Pours hazy Amber, medium creamy beige head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma of floral and pine hops, caramel. Docks is light plus sweet, light plus bitter, interesting. Medium body, lingering bitterness.
Aroma is light pine and Anchor Steam yeast. The flavor is grapefruit, malts, light citrus/fruit, Anchor Steam yeast and a bitter/slightly tart finish.

Deep, lightly hazed gold with a tall white head. Light toasted malt, sweet citrus, light floral, and mild earth. Soft yet noticeable bitterness in the finish. Medium body. I really enjoyed this variation. Refreshing and flavorful but easy drinking, too. Something I뇫 be happy to have a few of in an evening.

12 ounce bottle - $2.29 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a fairly clear, golden-amber body with a couple inches of lasting, off-white froth.

Smell: Lightly floral, citrusy notes over the pale malts, lightly bready. Scsantly grassy, hinting of woodsy mint with a backing of spiciness.

Taste: Lightly bready pale malts with a sliver of caramel. Minimally sweet. Spicy, lightly minty, woodsy hops with some lemony citrus. Medium bitterness. A gathering grassiness. Finishes dry, fairly clean with a little bit of crispness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation.

Overall: It뇹 still a fine, drinkable brew.

Pours deep amber into a shaker. Off-white head with excellent retention expands to top hat rim. Sweet over-ripe fruit and feet aromas. Sharp with sour over-ripe apricot, plums fruit and bitter earth front to back.

Bottle from Table and Vine. CLear copper with lasting head and lace. Caramel aroma with a hint of citrus and floral. Toasted caramel sweetness with some grassy malts and spicy bitterness that lingers with some toasted caramel in fairly dry finish. Medium light soft body. Pretty much like the original with a little extra floral in the aroma and spiciness in the finish. Pretty good.

The name is misleading, as this is NOT a dry hopped California Common. No, it뇹 just an aromatic lager based on Anchor뇹 world famous steam beer. It has a similar taste but it kinda ends there. Different recipe. Malty, slightly sweet, and easy to drink. Smells great. Easy going down. Solid drinker.

Clear slightly darker amber orange color, moderate head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is toast, light caramel, moderately fruity with light grapefruit and citrus. Medium to light body, certainly hoppier than the original but isn뇺 quite as quaffable. I뇴 guessing the majority will prefer this one.

$2.20 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours an amber-orange with a small off-white head. Aroma is mildly fruity, mildly floral without anything specific jumping out. Taste is crisp! Mildly citrus without feeling like an IPA or APA, some puckering spice, definitely good malts in the end... it finishes with a mild indiscernible fruitiness. My guess is that I like this better than the original - it뇹 been quite a few years since I had an Anchor Steam, bit I don뇺 remember enjoying it quite this much.

(12oz. bottle) - Big foamy head compared to the normal Anchor Steam bottle I bought. Aroma is much more resiny than the regular version. Burnt orange body. Flavor doesn뇺 seem to be nearly as bitter as the regular version, which surprises me a little. Clean palate. Decent beer. But, it뇹 nothing that is "hit me over the head" good.
Yeah, it뇹 a good beer. Probably better than the original, but I haven뇺 had the original in a long while so it뇹 hard to compare.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 Shared 12 oz. bottle from distributor rep at Lunar Brewing Co., poured to snifters showing a hazed, orangey gold color, with a presentable layer of soft white foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose was floral & fruity, with light malt sweetness, and a touch of grass & greenery. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, the taste added some low, earthy bitterness, and finished pleasantly crisp. More to the aroma & finish than the original, and remained very sessionable.

Surprisingly refreshing. Didn't know exactly what to expect but the extra character on the finish makes me like this better than the original

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells a lot like regular Anchor Steam, only a bit skunkier; I wanted a bolder scent. Looks great, light bronze color with a very bright white head that leaves tons of lacing. Also tastes a lot like regular Anchor Steam, the dry hopping is evident but should be stronger. The aftertaste is a little off to me, kinda funky. This was a gimmick. Consider this a review for regular Anchor Steam which I like, so I can뇺 give it too bad of a score. The dry hopping does not make it better in any way; if anything it makes it worse.

12 ounce bottle. Amber orange pour capped by a huge rocky beige head. Subtle citrus hops in nose. Flavor is light sweet malt with dry bitter hops. At first fruity citrus, then spicy bitter, with peppery notes. Long dry bitter finish. Easy to drink. As promised, much more hop-centric than the original Anchor Steam.

Bottle in Seattle. Modest tan-white foam, slight hazed orange beer. Grassy, fruity hop with a lot of the malt coming through. Tobacco, fruity malt, bitter grain. Earthy, grassy, plenty of bitter by the finish. This takes the base beer in a different direction, a bit more pleasant, but I don뇺 love this. A bit harsh throughout.
Bottle from six pack at Trader Joe뇹. Hazy burnt orange colored pour. Aroma is peach and cantaloupe. Flavor is light peach/nectarine, citrus mist and bitter hops.

355ml bottle. This is nowhere close to the original product. It still retains that "steam" charm but wow this is much dryer, the hops west coast, citrus and herb heavy , it just is damn fresh, crushable, and nice, drink it FRESH.

I have an idea! Lets take a meh beer and add shitty hops to it! What could possibly go wrong? +++ Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a bronze color with a large foamy orange-white head that left excellent lacing. The aroma was very faint with a bit of citrus, perfume and cactus. The flavor was bitter, dry and perfumey with a bit of citric hops and absolutely nothing else. Medium length hoppy finish. Medium body. Meh.

Pours a clear copper with a frothy white head. Aroma was slightly grassy, herbal and earthy hops, still has the caramel maltiness of the OG. Flavors were on point with straight Steam with a touch of hops. Medium mouthfeel, mouthfeel was silky smooth and well rounded in Anchor fashion. Good stuff, I think that the dry hop wasn뇺 over done. The integrity of the original remains intact.

The beer pours crystal clear copper with a sudsy dense beige head. The aroma has the mildly toasted malt of the original, smoothness, bread, caramel and such, but then has a more assertive herbal hoppiness. It has a medium body with some crispness and a good amount of carbonation. The taste starts like the aroma, but the hops are more up front with the herbal notes along with spiciness and grass. Really nice. While its way more hopped that the original steam, its pretty well balanced by todays standards.

Bottle from Total Wine in Sacramento, CA. Pours coppery gold with a creamy off-white head. Med body. Flavor is that maltiness of California Common, but there뇹 some interesting hop flavor. Not super strong, but somewhat complex. I뇳l go with floral and mildy earthy. Making me think of the hoppier English Ales. Tasty in its way.
